AttackerCapabilities: Understanding of file permissions and their implications

Vulnerabilities: Directory traversal vulnerability in POST filename
SecurityMeasures: Restriction of file permissions to prevent overwriting sensitive files

Steps.Description: Identify the vulnerability by adding debug prints to the file for the GET path and POST filename.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects a directory traversal vulnerability in either the GET path handling or the POST filename.
StepDetails.Action: Add debug prints to the file for the GET path and POST filename.
StepDetails.Result: Confirmation of a directory traversal vulnerability in POST filename.

Steps.Description: Exploit the directory traversal vulnerability to overwrite a file in the root directory.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes they can overwrite a file in the root directory using the directory traversal vulnerability.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a POST request with a filename that includes directory traversal (e.g., '../lol.txt').
StepDetails.Result: Successful overwrite of the file 'lol.txt' in the root directory with the content 'hacked'.

Steps.Description: Identify the target file to overwrite by analyzing the challenge description.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that they need to overwrite the '.bashrc' file to execute a command when the user 'manhndd' SSH-es in.
StepDetails.Action: Analyze the challenge description to identify the target file.
StepDetails.Result: Confirmation that the target file is the '.bashrc' file.

Steps.Description: Exploit the ability to overwrite the '.bashrc' file to execute a command when the user 'manhndd' SSH-es in.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes they can execute a command when the user 'manhndd' SSH-es in by overwriting the '.bashrc' file.
StepDetails.Action: Craft a POST request with a filename that includes directory traversal to overwrite the '.bashrc' file with a command execution payload.
StepDetails.Result: Successful overwrite of the '.bashrc' file with a command execution payload.

Steps.Description: Race against other players to win the race and execute the command in the '.bashrc' file before others.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker understands that there will be a race against other players to execute a command in the '.bashrc' file.
StepDetails.Action: Use Burp's repeater to repeatedly send the crafted POST request to win the race.
StepDetails.Result: Successful execution of the command in the '.bashrc' file before other players.

Steps.Description: Read the flag from '/var/secret' and write it to '/opt/mydank'.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes they can read the flag from '/var/secret' and write it to '/opt/mydank'.
StepDetails.Action: Write a Python script to read from '/var/secret' and write it to '/opt/mydank'.
StepDetails.Result: Successful reading of the flag from '/var/secret' and writing it to '/opt/mydank'.
